name: Rest Lengths
description: Short and Long Rests are defined periods of downtime that allow characters to recover resources.

shortRest.name: Short Rest
shortRest.description: A Short Rest is a period of downtime, at least 1 hour long, during which a character does nothing more strenuous than eating, drinking, reading, and tending to wounds.
benefits: Spend one or more Hit Dice to regain Hit Points (roll each die, add Constitution modifier)
Regain features that recharge on a Short Rest (e.g., Fighter's Second Wind, Warlock spell slots)
Can repeat for multiple short rests per day
restrictions: Cannot perform strenuous activity during the rest
If the rest is interrupted by a period of strenuous activity (at least 1 hour of walking, fighting, casting spells, or similar), the characters must begin the rest again

longRest.name: Long Rest
longRest.description: A Long Rest is a period of extended downtime, at least 8 hours long, during which a character sleeps for at least 6 hours and performs no more than 2 hours of light activity, such as reading, talking, eating, or standing watch.
benefits: Regain spent Hit Dice up to half your total (minimum 1)
Regain features that recharge on a Long Rest
Reduce Exhaustion level by 1 (if fed and watered)
restrictions: Must sleep for at least 6 of the 8 hours
Up to 2 hours of light activity allowed (reading, talking, standing watch)
If interrupted by strenuous activity (1 hour of walking, fighting, or similar), must restart
A character can benefit from only one Long Rest in a 24-hour period
Must have at least 1 Hit Point to start a Long Rest
